==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|ecka}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*agjō}}. Compare {{cog|en|edge}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈɛkə/}} * {{audio|de|De-Ecke.ogg|Audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Ecken|Eckchen}} # [[corner]], [[edge]] #: ''Der Tisch steht in der '''Ecke.''''' — “The table stands in the '''corner.'''” # a roughly [[triangular]] or [[quadrangular]] [[piece]] of something #: ''Gib mir mal eine kleine '''Ecke''' von dem Kuchen.'' #:: Give me a small '''piece''' of the cake, please. # {{lb|de|chiefly|colloquial}} [[region]]; [[area]]; [[neighbourhood]] #: ''Ihr wohnt ja hier in ’ner ganz netten '''Ecke.''''' #:: You guys live in a nice '''area''' around here. # {{lb|de|graph theory}} [[vertex]], [[node]] # {{lb|de|sports}} [[corner]] ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|graph theory}} {{l|de|Knoten}} * {{sense|sports}} {{l|de|Eckball}} ====Related terms==== {{top2}} * {{l|de|an der Ecke}} * {{l|de|anecken}} * {{l|de|die Ecke}} * {{l|de|Dreieck}} {{mid2}} * {{l|de|Eckdaten}} * {{l|de|eckig}} * {{l|de|um die Ecke bringen}} * {{l|de|um die Ecke}} {{bottom}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Pennsylvania German== ===Noun=== {{head|pdc|noun form}} # {{plural of|pdc|Eck}}
